wikipedia_page.main: Alex Pheby (born 1970) is a British author and academic. He currently teaches at the University of Greenwich, He studied at Manchester University, Manchester Metropolitan University, Goldsmiths. and UEA.

response: * Clarissa Delacroix, character from the book Mordew by Alex Pheby
* Schreber is the subject of British writer Alex Pheby's novel Playthings, (2015).

In 2004, Lucia Joyce's life was the subject of Calico, a West End play written by Michael Hastings, and, in 2012, of the graphic novel Dotter of Her Father's Eyes by Mary and Bryan Talbot. A play exploring her life, titled L, was performed to a limited audience in Concord Academy from 14 April to 16 April 2016. It was written and directed by Sophia Ginsburg.http://www.concordacademy.org/news/detail/index.aspx?LinkId=5507&ModuleId=280,485"The Directors Workshop Festival, April 15-16", "L; Written & Directed by Sophia Ginsburg; Choreography by Rhea Manwani & Cherilyn Lau", concordacademy.org. Retrieved 16 June 2019. In 2016, she was the subject of a biographical novel, The Joyce Girl by Annabel Abbs; in 2018, she was the subject of a novel by Alex Pheby, titled Lucia.Sansom, Ian (12 July 2018), "Lucia by Alex Pheby review – in search of James Joyce’s daughter", The Guardian. Lucia Joyce is the protagonist of the "Round the Bend" chapter of Alan Moore's 2016 novel Jerusalem. Set at the Northampton clinic where she spent her final years, the chapter is written in the style of her father's Finnegans Wake.

response: Mordew is a 2020 fantasy novel by British author Alex Pheby. It is the first in a planned trilogy.
